events.description: Heidi Hollis, college student, first encounters and begins documenting what becomes known as Hat Man phenomenon
Timothy M. Brown Jr. experiences teenage encounter; isolated reports begin appearing in early internet communities
First extensive radio discussion of shadow people phenomenon on Coast to Coast AM with Art Bell interviewing Thunder Strikes
Timothy M. Brown Jr. establishes dedicated website to collect and document Hat Man encounters globally
Regular appearances on Coast to Coast AM begin, popularizing Hat Man terminology and trademark claims
events.source: Coast to Coast AM guest logs

events.description: Internet forums like Something Awful and early Reddit feature recurring Hat Man discussion threads
Hat Man descriptions become widespread on social media platforms, establishing consistent visual characteristics
Documentation emerges linking Hat Man sightings to diphenhydramine (Benadryl) abuse in online communities
Sundance Film Festival debut of documentary exploring sleep paralysis and shadow people phenomena
Dr. Brian Sharpless publishes comprehensive sleep paralysis research identifying shadow people as most common hallucination type
Documentary 'The Hat Man: Documented Cases of Pure Evil' released featuring extensive case studies
Increased Hat Man content on social platforms, including dangerous trends of intentional Benadryl abuse
